basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Elysia Lopez, and I'm a student at Northwestern University studying Computer Science and Creative Writing. I enjoy intertwining software with storytelling, designing a project to the maximum benefit of the end user by understanding the role it plays in their story. I specialize in web development, especially using React.js (JavaScript), Django (Python), or HTML/CSS, but I have experience across the full stack, and I'm constantly learning new tools and technologies.

projects.title: Clowder
projects.description: An educational/social web app that shows a live map of active study groups around campus. Uses React for UI, Elixir for responsive backend, and Firebase for authentication. 1st Place Winner for Northwestern Wildhacks Hackathon 2023.

projects.title: Heartland
projects.description: A website with a unique take on wellness journaling. Built using React.js, Three.js, and Blender to render 3D components. Backend using Firebase auth and Postgres db. Best Design Award winner for Northwestern WildHacks Hackathon 2024.

projects.title: PoetryMood
projects.description: A web app that generates a poem using GPT-2, & classifies the mood of poem via Multinomial Naive Bayes classifier. Created UI using React. Built for the Northwestern IEEE Club yearly showcase.

projects.title: Pebble: Social Media Website
projects.description: A social media web app, inspired by BeReal. Generates a random personality question every day that users can respond to, and then browse answers to. Built for a Valentine's-themed hackathon.

projects.title: ARM Assembly Snake Game
projects.description: A snake game built entirely in ARM Assembly

projects.title: Derivative Visualizer
projects.description: An educational tool that visualizes a derivative relating to the limit of the slopes. Built using the C# Windows Forms framework.

projects.title: 8-Puzzle Game + A* Solver
projects.description: Uses the C# Blazor framework; A 3x3 tile game where the player can slide tiles around to put them in order. Includes an Auto-Solve option, which uses an A* pathfinding algorithm to demonstrate the fastest way to win.

projects.title: Battleships Game
projects.description: A full-stack project that involves a multiplayer Battleships game, hosted on a SQL database and utilizing a C# web API with a JS interface.

experience.company: Northwestern IEEE Club - Web Development Team
experience.title: Project Manager

experience.company: Northwestern IEEE Club - Machine Learning Team
experience.title: AI Engineer
